starvationevasion.sim

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • starvationevasion.sim.Simulator

  • public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main API point of the Starvation Evasion Simulator.
    This constructor should be called once at the start of each game by the Server.

    The design of this simulator is for its non-static methods to ONLY BE CALLED FROM A SINGLE THREAD (the main game loop thread) of the Server. The effect this has is that the server must guarantee synchronization of all clients before advancing the game turn.

      java.util.ArrayList<WorldData> nextTurn(java.util.ArrayList<GameCard> cards)
      FROM ONE THREAD ONLY, the Server should call nextTurn(cards) when it is ready to advance the simulator a turn (Constant.YEARS_PER_TURN years).

      Before calling nextTurn, the Server must: Verify all policy cards drafted by the clients during the draft phase. Verify that any cards discarded by a player could legally be discarded. Wait for all players to either finish the turn or time out clients that go over the turn phase time limit. Call discard(), FROM A SINGLE THREAD, on each card discarded by a player. End the voting phase and decide the results. Call discard on each card that did not receive enough votes. Call drawCards for each player and send them their new cards.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        This is called by the constructor to initialize the model. It may also be called to restart the model without needing to reallocate memory and without reloading the large data files.

      • getWorldData

        public java.util.ArrayList<WorldData> getWorldData(int yearFrom,
                                                   int yearThrough)
        At the start of the game, before dealing cards to players, the Server should call: getWorldData(Constant.FIRST_DATA_YEAR, Constant.FIRST_GAME_YEAR-1);
        Returns:
        data structure populated with all game state data needed by the client except high resolution data that might be needed by the visualizer.

      • getRegionBoundaries

        public GeographicArea[] getRegionBoundaries()

      • nextTurn

        public java.util.ArrayList<WorldData> nextTurn(java.util.ArrayList<GameCard> cards)
        FROM ONE THREAD ONLY, the Server should call nextTurn(cards) when it is ready to advance the simulator a turn (Constant.YEARS_PER_TURN years).

        Before calling nextTurn, the Server must:
        1. Verify all policy cards drafted by the clients during the draft phase.
        2. Verify that any cards discarded by a player could legally be discarded.
        3. Wait for all players to either finish the turn or time out clients that go over the turn phase time limit.
        4. Call discard(), FROM A SINGLE THREAD, on each card discarded by a player.
        5. End the voting phase and decide the results.
        6. Call discard on each card that did not receive enough votes.
        7. Call drawCards for each player and send them their new cards.
        Parameters:
        cards - Combined list of ALL PolicyCards enacted this turn by ALL players.
        Note: Since this is a combined list, all clients must report their cards and votes or be timed out before the server may call this method.
        Note: cards played but not enacted (did not get required votes) must NOT be in this list. Such cards must be discarded (call discard(EnumRegion playerRegion, PolicyCard card)) before calling this method.
        Returns:
        data structure populated with all game state data needed by the client except high resolution data that might be needed by the visualizer.

      • getCurrentYear

        public int getCurrentYear()

      • drawCards

        public EnumPolicy[] drawCards(EnumRegion playerRegion)
        The server must call this for each playerRegion before the first turn and during each turn's draw phase. This method will return the proper number of cards from the top of the given playerRegion's deck taking into account cards played and discarded by that player.
        Parameters:
        playerRegion - region of player who id given the drawn cards.
        Returns:
        collection of cards.

      • getCardsInHand

        public EnumPolicy[] getCardsInHand(EnumRegion playerRegion)

      • getCardsInDiscard

        public java.util.ArrayList<EnumPolicy> getCardsInDiscard(EnumRegion playerRegion)

      • discard

        public void discard(EnumRegion playerRegion,
                    EnumPolicy card)
        The Server must call this for each card that is discarded before calling nextTurn(). There are three different ways a card may be discarded:
        1. During the draft phase, a player may use an action to discard up to 3 policy cards and immediately draw that many new cards. Using an action means the player can draft one less policy that turn. What is meant by immediately is that a player who does this and who still has a remaining action, may draft one of the newly drawn cards during that same draft phase.
        2. As part of each draft phase, each player may discard a single policy card. Cards discarded this way are not replaced until the draw phase (after the voting phase).
        3. A policy that is drafted, bt does not receive the required votes is discarded.
        Parameters:
        playerRegion - player who owns the discarded card.
        card - to be discarded.

        Returns:

      • getRegion

        public EnumRegion getRegion(float latitude,
                            float longitude)
        Parameters:
        latitude - Latitude ranges from -90 to 90. North latitude is positive.
        longitude - Longitude ranges from -180 to 180. East longitude is positive.
        Returns:
        The region containing the given latitude and longitude or null if the given location is not within a game region.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This entry point is for testing only.

        This test shows how to instantiate the simulator and how to tell it to deal each player a hand of cards.

        Parameters:
        args - ignored.
